name: Circular Charlie
notes: Probability is a ratio of x:y. This is a problem that can be solved by using combination to count x ({n-2}C10) and count y (distribute into bins 14C10).

name: Colorful Cube
notes: There are 8 vertices on a cube and also a cube has 6 sides. The question prompts counting all the ways the sides can be fixed y (6! sides) and x (8 vertices x 3! ways of arranging fixed sides x 3! ways of arranging the other remaining sides).

name: Modified Deck Pair
notes: Count the ways you can get a pair (9 suites x 4C2 or picking the already matching suite +1) and divide that by drawing k cards from all the number of ways the remaining cards (38C2) can be arranged.

name: Unfriendly
notes: The easiest way to compute this is to calculate the total number of ways to invite people (8C5) and then subtracting those that invite both (6C3).

name: 2D Paths II
notes: Gridwalk. Let P_1 and P_2 be the events that your character through (2.3) and (4.6) and then use inclusion-exclusion for double counting.

name: 9 Sum II
notes: A classic problem in probability. Represent the number in terms of its digits: x_1 x_2 x_3 ... x_n. Since x_1 cannot be zero then represent with x'_1 + ... x_n = 9-1 where the solution becomes (9+ndigits-1)C(ndigits-1).

name: Baby Boy
notes: Conditional probability introduces conditional EV. Simple application of Bayes' theorem and noticing the unkown term cancels out after writing down the equation.

name: Conditional Double Heads
notes: Bayes' theorem application and setting-up the equation as p_n > 19/20 and p_n = (1/20)/(1/20 + 19/(20*2^n)).

name: Matching Die Pair
notes: There are two cases to consider. When the dice values are the same 1/36 x 1/6 and (+) are different 1/36 x 5/6 x 2 (since dies are non-distict i.e. ab or ba look the same).

name: Red Blue Equality
notes: Solve for x after setting up the equation from drawing the first item 3/(x+3) and second item 2/(x+2).

name: Better in Red III
notes: Bayes' theorem application with counting and (brainteaser) considering that the particular cube in the middle will not have a side repainted to red.

name: Rainbow Selection
notes: Solve for x after setting up the equation without replacement.
